title: Reconnecting to New Client Issue
body:
Hello, I did a post about a week ago with this issue but I probably put it in the wrong category.

I'm posting this hoping someone from Riot will see this and be able to help me with this problem I've been having with the new client that's holding me back from using it 100% of the time.

I have an issue where my client will randomly DC from the servers for literally a second, on the old client this is no problem as all I have to do is press "ok" and I'm reconnected without any problem. On the new client, however, when I DC there's this countdown and after the countdown is done the only option I have is to press the "Exit Now" button.

Is there any possible way that this can be changed to how it works on the old client? Or an option to do so? I really like the look and feel of the new client, but I am basically forced to use the old one because of this small issue/annoyance.

Thank you for taking the time to read this!

                                   - The Thunder Goat {{champion:240}}

replies.body:
It sounds like the core issue here is that your connection is dropping out for a second. That's definitely not good, as it could cause many issues in various parts of the client or in-game. This is likely caused by one or more network settings that League doesn't play well with. I recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your settings are in the clear.

Let me know if you continue to experience issues.

Hey! Thanks for taking the time to reply to me!

So over the past couple days I've tried to go through the connection guide and here are my findings.

-**Firewall Troubleshooting**: I've changed this, and it seems to have helped a bit, the problem still happens but not as much so this was really nice.

-**Configuring My DNS**: When I did this change it actually made it worse, and the client disconnected even more than before.

-**Port Forwarding**: This didn't seem to have any effect.

-**RELEASE/RENEW IP AND FLUSH DNS**: This step is similar as the firewall fix, where it seemed to have helped, but not fix the problem 100%

Overall, going through the guide has helped me a bit and I disconnect from the client less often now, where it only happens a few times a day (where it used to happen a few times every 15 or so minutes).

Thank you for suggesting that I go through the connection guide!

Since you're still experiencing some issues after taking those connection steps, I'd like you to run a traceroute during a time you experience symptoms so we can ensure your route to the server isn't an issue. I'd like you to use a program named [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to complete this. After loading up the application, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 min has gone by, you can export the test results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you have any issues running that trace.

Wow, your traceroute actually looks normal here and didn't capture any issues that could explain why you're seeing these symptoms. Did you happen to run this while you experienced the micro-disconnection symptoms? You may be able to confirm if this issue is happening in your route by temporarily using a VPN while testing the client for further disconnections. There are many VPN's out there, but I recommend testing with [**Cyberghost**](http://www.cyberghostvpn.com/en_us) or [**Hotspot Shield.**](https://www.hotspotshield.com/)

Let me know if you saw any changes.

Yeah that's what I mean, everything seems normal and I don't experience drop outs in other programs or even disconnect in-game.

So I tried both the programs you recommended and these were my findings:
* I tried Cyberghost first. I used it when I was experiencing problems and it seemed to have gotten rid of the problem. I did, however, experience higher ping in game (going from my usual 39 to ~130). I couldn't change the server hotspot from the Southern US to southern Ontario where I currently reside.
* I had the same result and issue with Hotspot Shield.

I guess I'm starting to get a little anxious now as Riot has announced that soon they will be moving everyone to the new client, and if I still experience this problem it's going to be really frustrating dealing with it :/
Anyways, hopefully with the results from using a VPN lead to a solution that'll fix the problem!

Since you didn't experience the same issues while using a VPN, it means the issue resides in your standard network routing with your ISP. It's likely there's a bad node (network hop) that's causing a brief drop in your connection. I strongly recommend reaching out to your ISP's tier 2 support and provide the context of the traceroute and the fact that a VPN was able to temporarily resolve the issue, while only affecting your latency (ping) due to the reroute.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

Hey it's been a while. I thought I'd update you on what happened after I called my ISP.
They started off by letting me know that on the LTE network we are on we have a dynamic IP address and is most likely the reason why I am experience the quick disconnects from the client. They said there was nothing they could do about it at this current time.

There is light at the end of the tunnel, though. They told me that at some point this year they will be adding a static IP address on the network because it has been requested a lot (probably a lot of people calling in with the same problem). This seems to be the fix that I cannot wait to be released so I can enjoy this game and the new client fully!

When I get this new static IP and I still encounter issues I'll run through all the tests again and let you know my findings and then let my ISP know what is going on.

Thanks again for all your help!

Chris "The Thunder Goat" {{champion:240}}
